{{cpp/title|flush_emit}}
{{cpp/io/manip/navbar}}
{{ddcl | header=ostream | since=c++20|
template&lt; class CharT, class Traits &gt;
std::basic_ostream&lt;CharT, Traits&gt;&amp; flush_emit( std::basic_ostream&lt;CharT, Traits&gt;&amp; os );
}}

Flushes the output sequence {{tt|os}} as if by calling {{c|os.flush()}}. Then, if {{c|os.rdbuf()}} actually points to a {{c|std::basic_syncbuf&lt;CharT, Traits, Allocator&gt;}} {{tt|buf}}, calls {{c|buf.emit()}}.

This is an output-only I/O manipulator, it may be called with an expression such as {{c|out &lt;&lt; std::flush_emit}} for any {{tt|out}} of type {{lc|std::basic_ostream}}.


===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par | os | reference to output stream }}
{{par end}}

===Return value===

{{tt|os}} (reference to the stream after manipulation)
